about.heroSubtitle: A hyper-local platform connecting Berliners through trusted, flexible, neighbourhood-based work.
about.storyP1: JobsPerHour Berlin was founded by Saurav Sharma and Zeeshan Nazir, a duo united by firsthand experience of Berlin‚Äôs isolation paradox and a shared vision to build community through local, trusted work.
about.storyP2: When we first arrived in Berlin, we saw talented people with so much to offer, but no way to connect meaningfully with the community around them. This platform is the bridge we wish we had.
about.storyGoal: Our Goal: To turn strangers into neighbours, and neighbours into helpers, building a Berlin where no one feels invisible.
about.missionText: To turn Berlin‚Äôs isolation into connection by building a trusted, hyper-local platform where every neighbour can find help, offer skills, and belong.
about.visionText: To become Europe‚Äôs leading community platform, redefining city life through trust, flexibility, and neighbourly support. JobsPerHour Berlin is the blueprint for a replicable model that turns hyper-local connections into scalable solutions for social integration and resilient local economies across Germany and Europe.
about.founder1Desc:
Saurav brings over a decade of experience leading teams and managing complex projects in global organizations, including Lovely Professional University and Concentrix (ex-IBM).

He personally experienced the challenges newcomers face in Berlin and envisioned a platform that builds trust and community.

He holds a Global MBA from BSBI with certifications in Project Management, Six Sigma, Operations Management, and Digital Marketing.

Role: Vision, business strategy, partnerships, operations, fundraising, team building, and impact.
about.founder2Desc:
Full-Stack Expertise: Proficient in React.js, Node.js, MongoDB, and cloud deployment ‚Äî the exact stack needed to build and scale the platform.

Proven Project Builder: Built and deployed complex web applications including a Project Management Dashboard and an E-Commerce Platform handling high transaction volumes.

Results-Driven Engineering: Optimized system performance, improving load speeds by 30% and reducing checkout times.

Planned Role: End-to-end technical execution, platform architecture, security, and scaling.
